ActuatableProperty,madeActuation,some,Ac.description: This property is designed to be directly affected by an actuation process, indicating a clear relationship between the property and the action taken. If any actuation processes exist, they must all correspond to the defined Actuation.

System,hasSubSystem,some,System.reason: The constraint regarding the inclusion of SubSystems has been removed, so the support text no longer mentions or depends on any aspect of SubSystems.

System,hasSubSystem,some,System.description: This System may include SubSystems that work collaboratively to achieve overarching goals. If any SubSystems exist, they must all be Systems.
System,hasSubSystem,some,System.reason: The 'only' variant emphasizes that while SubSystems may be present, any SubSystems that are included must strictly be Systems.

System,implements,some,Procedure.description: Every System is defined as a structured arrangement that operates within a specific Platform and hosts various components, including Deployments and potentially SubSystems that work together to achieve overarching goals. This definition does not constrain the System with any specific process implementations.
System,implements,some,Procedure.reason: The constraint involving the implementation of specific Procedures was entirely removed, so the support text no longer mentions or depends on the procedure implementation aspect.

System,implements,some,Procedure.description: Every System implements specific Procedures that guide its operations and functionalities. If any Procedures are implemented, they must all be the ones that guide its operations and functionalities.
System,implements,some,Procedure.reason: The 'only' variant ensures that while Systems implement Procedures, every Procedure present must exclusively meet the criterion defined in the support text.
